meanings.definition: To soil or tarnish the reputation of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Gossiping about others can besmirch their good name.
meanings.sent2: The mud besmirches the once pristine white dress.
meanings.sent3: Spreading rumors only besmirches your own credibility.
meanings.sent4: His dishonesty besmirches the integrity of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The scandalous news quickly besmirched her previously flawless image.

meanings.sent1: The ink besmirches the paper, making it unreadable.
meanings.sent2: The dust from the old books besmirches the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The muddy pawprints besmirched the freshly cleaned floor.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti besmirched the walls of the historic building.
meanings.sent5: The spilled coffee besmirched her favorite shirt, leaving a stain.
